note.p: Congregational minister. Born in Dublin, son of Thomas Travers Sherlock (1830–82), surgeon. BA, London, 1875. Minister in Smethick, Staffordshire, 1883–1915. Prominent Christian Socialist. Advocated land reform and trade unionism.
Census returns of England and Wales 1911 (The National Archives: Public Record Office RG14/17960/398)

University of London Historical Record 1836–1926, http://www.senatehouselibrary.ac.uk/our-collections/special-collections/archives-manuscripts/university-of-london-students-1836-1934 (accessed 25 January 2017)
